de.dfki.lt.hfc.types

Class XsdDateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.types.AnyType
      • de.dfki.lt.hfc.types.XsdAnySimpleType
        • de.dfki.lt.hfc.types.XsdDateTime

  • public final class XsdDateTime
extends XsdAnySimpleType
    an encoding of the XSD dateTime format "[+|-]yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS" _without_ time zones; if less ``precision'' is needed, use the XsdDate class note: I do NOT check, e.g., whether month is between 1 and 12, or whether day is between 1 and 31, given that month is 8 (August), or that there is a 29th February in a leap year note: the class XsdUDateTime even provides un(der)specified time
    Since:
    JDK 1.5
    See Also:
    XsdUnDateTime, http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/, http://www.schemacentral.com/sc/xsd/t-xsd_dateTime.html

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int day
      these fields are all of type int; I represent the sign in a separate boolean field
      int hour
      these fields are all of type int; I represent the sign in a separate boolean field
      int minute
      these fields are all of type int; I represent the sign in a separate boolean field
      int month
      these fields are all of type int; I represent the sign in a separate boolean field
      float second
      second is the only field that is of type float in order to represent parts of a second
      boolean sign
      - = BC = false + = AD = true in case NO sign is specified, sign defaults to true
      int year
      these fields are all of type int; I represent the sign in a separate boolean field

      Constructors

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String toName()
      generates a string representation from the internal fields, but omits the XSD type specification
      java.lang.String toString(boolean shortIsDefault)
      depending on shortIsDefault, either the suffix de.dfki.lt.hfc.Namespace.XSD_DATETIME_SHORT or de.dfki.lt.hfc.Namespace.XSD_DATETIME_LONG is used; note that toString() does NOT check whether the internal description is well-formed; e.g., we do not check whether 1 <= month <= 12 or whether 1 <= day <= 29 for month 02 (= February)
      static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String val, boolean shortIsDefault)
      binary version is given the value directly

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean shortIsDefault)
        depending on shortIsDefault, either the suffix de.dfki.lt.hfc.Namespace.XSD_DATETIME_SHORT or de.dfki.lt.hfc.Namespace.XSD_DATETIME_LONG is used; note that toString() does NOT check whether the internal description is well-formed; e.g., we do not check whether 1 <= month <= 12 or whether 1 <= day <= 29 for month 02 (= February)

      • toName

        public java.lang.String toName()
        generates a string representation from the internal fields, but omits the XSD type specification
        Specified by:
        toName in class AnyType
        See Also:
        if the object is an URI, the angle brackets are omitted; if it is a blank node, the prefix "_:" is omitted; if it is an XSD atom, the outer quotes '\"' as well as a potential succeeding XSD type is omitted; furthermore, if the object is an XSD string, spaces and angle brackets are replaced by the underscore character '_'
